sn35.71:2.2: Commentary traces anassasaṁ (variant anassāsiṁ) to √nas (perish), which Digital Pali Dictionary rejects as “unviable”. It is, rather, the present participle of na assasati, “discouraged, unconsoled”.
sn35.71:5.1: The Buddha encourages with the future tense, rather than the optative “should”. This is an example of his knowledge of where all paths leads.
